headline: CNN Newsroom
subHeadline: No Classified Materials Found at Biden Vacation Home; Top U.S. House Republican Hopeful After Biden Meeting; Federal Reserve Hikes Interest Ratees a Quarter Point; Ukraine Launches Nationwide Anti- Corruption Raids; Remembering Tyre Nichols. Aired 4-4:30a ET

utterances.speaker: BIANCA NOBILO, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Hello and a warm welcome to our viewers joining us in the United States and everywhere around the world. I'm Bianca Nobilo live from London. Max Foster has the day off today. Just ahead on CNN NEWSROOM.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This is the third property that is associated with President Biden that the FBI has visited.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The president from the very beginning of having total cooperation with the Justice Department.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Tyre was a beautiful person. And for this to happen to him is unimaginable.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Legacy of Tyre Nichols is that we have equal justice swiftly.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This time the man many consider the greatest player in NFL history seems to really mean it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It is time. He has proved everything he needs to prove. So go ahead, move forward.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Live from London this is CNN NEWSROOM with Max Foster and Bianca Nobilo.

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: It is Thursday, February 2, 9(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) IAN SAMS, WHITE HOUSE COUNSEL'S OFFICE: Look, I think that we are not going to get ahead of potential speculation and steps that could happen in the investigation. The president has been fully cooperative and he's directed his team to be fully cooperative. And that's because he believes in the independence of the Justice Department. He believes in giving them the space to conduct a thorough review and to conduct that review efficiently. That's why he's moving quickly to give them access to his home in Wilmington, to get access to his home in Rehoboth so they can do a full search so that they are able to get access to the information so that they can move ahead in their review. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: The searches into multiple properties would appear be a clear sign that the U.S. Justice Department is remaining vigilant in its investigation. CNN's Jessica Schneider reports(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JESSICA SCHNEIDER, CNN JUSTICE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: This was a third FBI search and it lasted for 3 1/2 hours Wednesday at President Joe Biden's Rehoboth Beach, Delaware house. No classified documents were found, however. And President Biden's personal attorney released a statement after the search saying that it was conducted in coordination and cooperation with the president's attorneys. And in an earlier statement he said that the FBI and the DOJ had the president's full support and cooperation.And of course that cooperation has really been a constant theme from the White House. They've repeatedly sought to differentiate the ongoing investigation into President Biden's handling of classified information from that obstruction investigation that's going into former President Trump and his team because of documents found down at Mar-a-Lago. Notably though at the same time this FBI search was underway, the special counsel handling Biden's case had just started on Wednesday. It's Robert Hur, he will be leading that investigation. But there is still a lot of questions as to what exactly has been found from Biden's homes and even his former office. Our team has learned that dozens of classified documents in all have been found. No details though on what exactly the documents contain. And Biden's team on Wednesday did say that even though no classified documents were found, DOJ did take some handwritten notes that were from Biden's time as vice president from the Rehoboth home. So, that's the second instance where handwritten notes have been taken. The last time was during that search about two weeks ago that lasted 13 hours at the Wilmington house. So now the question is will there be any more searches by the FBI and it really is still a possibility as this investigation moves forward. Jessica Schneider, CNN, Washington. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: Attorneys for Hunter Biden are calling for a criminal investigation into a computer repair shop owner and several Republican political figures. They say private and personal information about the president's son has been exploited and weaponized. Biden's lawyers are not saying how Rudy Giuliani, Steve Bannon and others came into possession of the information but is reported to have come from Biden's laptop. Take a listen to former FBI deputy director Andrew McCabe.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: In a 2021 interview, Hunter Biden said that he didn't remember dropping off his laptop for repair, although the repair shop owner said he did.The controversy surrounding U.S. Congressman George Santos are continuing to grow. Santos has been caught in a number of deceptions about his education, work experience and family is now being investigated by the FBI. They are looking into this U.S. Navy veteran's allegation, that Santos set up a GoFundMe account to pay for life-saving surgery for his beloved service dog but took off with the money instead. Here is what Rich Osthoff told CNN last month. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) RICH OSTHOFF, U.S. NAVY VETERAN: I don't want you to ever hurt anybody like you hurt me again, George. And nobody else should ever have to go through that. I almost killed myself when that dog died. That's why I'm here. I don't want him to be able to do it again. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: Osthoff said that he's cooperating with the feds and handed over text message exchanges with Santos to them. Santos declined to comment and he was asked about this issue on Wednesday.Now two new developments in the investigation into Donald Trump's alleged role in a hush money payment scheme. Sources say a top executive at the Trump Organization Jeffrey McConney is set to appear before a Manhattan grand jury today. His expected appearance comes as prosecutors ramp up their probe into the scheme to stop adult film star Stormy Daniels from going public about a past alleged affair with Trump just before the 2016 presidential election. Trump has denied the affair. Now there's no tangible progress in talks over raising the U.S. debt limit. But top House Republican Kevin McCarthy sounded hopeful that he and President Joe Biden can reach an agreement long before the deadline that would trigger a default, possibly as early as June. REP. KEVIN MCCARTHY (R-CA) U.S. HOUSE SPEAKER: I thought the meeting today was a good first start. That doesn't mean that it all comes to fruition, but walking out I can see that it could come together. I was very hopeful from the meeting. It was better than I thought. Just like anything else. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: But each day without a deal brings the U.S. one step closer to default and the consequences would be dire. CNN's Phil Mattingly has the latest on the negotiations.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: PHIL MATTINGLY, CNN CHIEF WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: President Biden and Speaker Kevin McCarthy met for more than an hour in the Oval Office, there was nothing on camera. There were no statements by the two leaders at least before the meeting. After the meeting the Speaker came out described the meeting that lasted more than an hour as productive. Said it was a good meeting. Said markets that are concerned about the potential for a U.S. default, the first in the history of the country, should feel better about things.Why? Well, that still remains an open question. I think the fact that they had a conversation at all seems to be viewed as progress from McCarthy's side of things. However, the two prospectives which are wildly divergent in terms of what the outcome should be. When it comes to the debt limit, they're still wildly divergent. And while McCarthy said it was a positive meeting, Biden in a statement after the meeting said it was a productive discussion. There is no clear way to lay out a path toward avoiding default at this point in time. And still White House officials make it abundantly clear the president is dead set on the idea that there will be no negotiations despite what Republicans insist. Take a listen.

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: U.S. financial markets are hoping to keep the momentum going when trading begins on Wall Street in just a few hours. Stock futures are looking to open but of course that could change. Stock futures at the moment mixed picture. We'll see if they can keep -- keep that positivity going to the rest of the day. Because on Wednesday the Dow gained ground late in session but then finished flat. The Nasdaq surged 2 percent and the S&P 500 closed more than 1 percent higher.The rally was surged by the Federal Reserve's announcement that inflation is easing and it would be hiking interest rates by only a quarter of a percent. CNN's Matt Egan has the details. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: MATT EGAN, CNN REPORTER
utterances.sentences: Bianca, the Feds warned inflation isn't over, but it is shifting. This 25 basis point rate increase from the Fed is the smallest since this fight against inflation began back in March. But the Fed is still trying to slow this economy down, to knock inflation down. But it's gone from slamming the brakes on the economy to tapping the brakes. And that is an important shift because it lowers the risk that the Fed ends up causing an accident either in financial markets or in the real economy or in both.And the Fed is changing its tune on inflation a bit. The statement says that inflation remains elevated, but it also concedes that it has eased. And during the press conference Fed Chair Jerome Powell, he declared that the disinflation process has begun and he said he's pleased to see the prices are cooling off. Also during the press conference Powell didn't really seem bothered by the January boom in financial markets even though soaring stock prices actually makes the job harder for the Fed to cool off inflation. Markets seemed to like what Powell had to say with stocks rally during the press conference. But I would note that Powell did still talk tough about inflation. He said that it is way too premature to declare victory. And listen to this clip. JEROME POWELL, U.S. FEDERAL RESERVE CHAIR: It is very difficult to manage the risk of doing too little and finding out in 6 or 12 months that we actually were close but didn't get the job done. Inflation springs back and we have go back in. And now you really do worry about expectations getting inadequate and that kind of thing. This is a very difficult risk to manage.

utterances.speaker: EGAN
utterances.sentences: And Powell didn't really seem worried about the Fed going too far, saying that they know how to deal with that. At the end of the day -- listen, the Fed sounds more encouraged about inflation. The Fed is slowing the pace of rate hikes. Their job isn't done here, but it does feel as though we are much closer to the end of this rate hiking campaign than the beginning -- Bianca.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: Matt Egan there for us.And it seems things could get worse for some U.S. retailers. Bed Bath & Beyond announced his closing nearly 90 locations as the company nears bankruptcy. "Wall Street Journal" reports that the company failed to make debt payments totaling more than $28 million that were due on Wednesday. Bed Bath & Beyond is no stranger to closures though. Since last February its announced the closure of more than 200 stores. A rescue operation is ongoing in eastern Ukraine in the city Kramatorsk where officials say a Russian missile hit a residential area killing at least three people. Eight others were wounded in the attack and one official says that at least two people may still be trapped under the rubble. At least eight apartment buildings were damaged and one of them completely destroyed. Meantime in a nearby Bakhmut, Ukraine reports heavy fighting while pro-Russian forces claim to be close to encircling the key Ukrainian city. And all of this, as Ukraine is also stepping up its fight against what it calls its internal enemy, corruption. Security forces raided locations across the country on Wednesday. And to discuss this Scott McLean is joining us now. Scott, this has been a story that's ramping up of late. Zelenskyy's very visible fight against internal corruption. But the reports that we're getting, particularly the raiding of this billionaire Ihor Kolomoyskyy who had very close connections to Zelenskyy throughout his political career seems to be a whole new level of commitment to this.

utterances.speaker: KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: We demand Congress pass the George Floyd Justice and Policing Act. Joe Biden will sign it. And we should not delay and we will not be denied. It is nonnegotiable.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris was among the mourners attending an emotional funeral for the 29-year-old Tyre Nichols in Memphis, Tennessee on Wednesday. Nichols died last month following a violence encounter with Memphis police. Five former officers now face murder charges. One of the city's main brigades was -- bridges was lit up as a tribute to Nichols. And will get more now from CNN's Ryan Young in Memphis. And we have to warn you that some of the images in his report may be disturbing.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) ROWVAUGHN WELLS, TYRE NICHOLS' MOTHER: Tyre was a beautiful person. And for this to happen to him is just unmanageable. RYAN YOUNG, CNN NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT (voice over): A goodbye to a beloved son, moving tributes and a call for change. RODNEY WELLS, TYRE NICHOLS' STEPFATHER: We have to fight for justice. We cannot continue to let these people brutalize our kids. YOUNG (voice-over): Grieving family and friends celebrating the life of Tyre Nichols today.

utterances.speaker: ROWVAUGHN WELLS
utterances.sentences: I promise you the only thing that's keeping me going is the fact that I really choose to believe my son was sitting here on the side of me from God.KEYANA DIXON, TYRE NICHOLS' SISTER: I see the world showing him love and fighting for his justice. But all I want is my baby brother back. LATOYA YIZAR, TYRE NICHOLS' SISTER: I'm just trying to go home. Don't I deserve to feel safe? YOUNG (voice-over): A young father, artist and avid skateboarder who died after a violent encounter with Memphis police.

utterances.speaker: BEN CRUMP, CIVIL RIGHTS ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Why couldn't they see the humanity in Tyre? Because we have to make sure they see us as human beings.YOUNG (voice-over): Civil rights leaders, community members and officials, including Vice President Kamala Harris.

utterances.speaker: SHARPTON
utterances.sentences: We are going to change this country because we refuse to keep living under the threat of the cops and the robbers.

utterances.speaker: YOUNG
utterances.sentences: One of the most emotional parts is when you had Tyre's sisters talking about him wanting just to get home. That poem that she wrote spoke to him about just trying to reach home. And you think about him calling out for his mother. A lot of emotion here especially with other mothers coming to this funeral to pay their respects to this family.Ryan Young, CNN, Memphis, Tennessee. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: As Ryan just mentioned, Memphis authorities are now looking to release a lot more recordings of the tragic incident. Speaking earlier to CNN, the lead prosecutor explained how these additional recordings could result in more charges being filed. Take a listen.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: STEVEN MULROY, SHELBY COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: It's fair to say that the incident report that has gone public does not match up on all fours with what one sees when you look at the video that's already been released. There is a lot of footage, maybe as much as 20 hours, and some of it I think may be more relevant because of the audio and a lot of it depicts things that take place, you know, after the beating has already occurred and, you know, people are sort of talking afterwards, even after the ambulance takes Mr. Nichols away.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: NOBILO
utterances.sentences: The five former officers now charged with Nichols' murder expected to be arraigned on February 17.Still ahead the U.S. and Philippines are deepening their military cooperation concerned over China's growing influence in the Pacific regions. We'll have a live report on their defense pact. Plus, the latest on the extreme weather hitting the U.S.
